title: Republicans’ Effort to Reclaim Senate Stumbles in New Hampshire
sub_head: Gov. Chris Sununu dashes hopes of Trump, McConnell to run against incumbent Sen. Maggie Hassan
body:
WASHINGTON—New Hampshire Gov. Chris Sununu said he won’t run for the Senate, dealing a setback to Minority Leader Mitch McConnell’s efforts to recruit top candidates in the Republican Party’s effort to reclaim control of the chamber.
Republicans had called Mr. Sununu, who has governed mostly as a centrist, one of their best hopes to win a Democrat-held seat if he ran. Mr. Sununu said at a press conference Tuesday morning that he won’t challenge incumbent Sen. Maggie Hassan for her seat and would instead run for a fourth term as governor.
